title: ADC vs DPS Mages
body:
"Azir has no meaningful weaknesses in his current state" - Meddler 15th september
How about flashing / dashing past his soldiers once he uses Q leaving him with literally no way to fight you other than basic auto attacks?

It's frustrating to see how you continuously destroy DPS mages , you simply ignore key requirements (like Cassiopeia having to land Q or being restricted by mana) and nerf them to a point where Lucien or Corki just replace them in mid. 

Like nerfing all AP items, giving everyone free MR and adding Adaptive Helmet wasn't destructive enough to DPS mages. We have ADC not only being played in the botlane, but also in the midlane (Lucien, Corki) and in the jungle (Twitch, Ezreal) and somehow you decide to nerf DPS mages out of the meta instead, every time they are remotely close to being viable.

**Opposed to ADC DPS-Mages actually have counterplay. Yet a Cassiopeia {{champion:69}}  can be place #98 in terms of winrate (Diamond rank OP.GG stats, dropped further to #100 today 15th september, #104 16th september) and be nerfed while a #10 winrate Twitch {{champion:29}}  remains untouched.
**

replies.body:
Azir wasn't just a simple DPS mage.

He had the range of an artillery mage.
The damage of a dps mage.
The mobility of a long range Diver.
The initiation potential of a Vanguard thanks to his shuffle.
The zoning of a control mage.

All these aspects combined, it is true, a well played Azir had no weakness whatsoever.
There is a reason that Azir was pretty much the alpha predator of the rift when he was strong.

The changes aim to shift him over to a battlemage and therefore they want to implement the disadvantages of this subclass in his kit.
A good azir is your worst nightmare.
So is a bad Azir (read: my Azir)... when he is on your team
OP is just a low elo mid main who thinks azir at his prime isn't the most overpowered thing this world has ever seen

I don't get people who are justifying that champion.
I am kinda in the same boat, I really like Kalista from her thematic, gameplay and all that stuff.

But I still accept that if she is strong, she is absolutely busted and definitely needs a rework.

Somewhere around season 4, riot decided to make the following design philosophy changes
1. Burst mages aren't a hard counter to ADC early or mid game
2. ADCs will becomes the ultimate carry

Since season 4, riot has shifted their goal to make ADCs the primary carry. We see in LCS where that agenda has taken hold. We now see ADC champions in mid lane more than 80% of mages. Outside Taliyah (already nerfed), Orianna, and Syndra, there aren't any real viable mid lane mages. Most will get bullied out by an ADC Lucian or Corki

We aren't there yet, but another season with changes that are designed like the previous 1-2 years will make ADCs played in mid more than many mages.

Anything viable in LCS tends to get nerfed but ADCs tend to get buff to them or something that relates to them more than other. When tanks were reworked, the only other items that got buffed where ADC items.. 

I'm not arguing or complaining about these changes. In solo q, anybthing is viable and mid lane is still mostly mages and assassins but in pro play, we have see what these gradual changes have done to mid lane

When is the last time you saw a traditional mid lane in pro play? A karthus? An Anivia? A xerath?

We have see what happens in games when players pick these champions against lucians..etc. they get bullied in lane, die one, and lose the tower. They get out scaled.
yup they think ap burst mages have "no counterplay" rip veigar and dfg. but crit burst mages (adc) are just fine
Okay honestly the community overreaction to the DFG and Mage changes at that time were seriously overblown and not the best example.

> [{quoted}](name=Kowe The Ewok,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Ygwn0dWE,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-09-15T17:59:53.812+0000)
>
> &quot;Azir has no meaningful weaknesses in his current state&quot; - how about flashing / dashing past his soldiers once he uses Q leaving him with literally no way to fight you other than basic auto attacks?

You can't dash past his wall - only flash. And his Q has insane range, only Ahri could close that gap with her dashes and flash. Literately nobody else has the chance to get to him before he's just walked back to his turret, barring a Yasuo or Akali _when Azir's minions are walking by him_.

> It&#039;s frustrating to see how you continuously destroy DPS mages , you simply ignore key requirements (like Cassiopeia having to land Q or being restricted by mana) and nerf them to a point where Lucien or Corki just replace them in mid. 

Corki's pretty much _always_ been a midlaner, and he's basically an AD/AP caster. You can't count him as an ADC any more than you can count Quinn as one. Lucain's only in mid because he's kinda bad in bot, and because he does well against Kassadin (who is a relatively popular pick in top-tier). He still loses almost automatically to most mages.

> Like nerfing all AP items, giving everyone free MR, adding Adaptive Helmet wasn&#039;t destructive enough to DPS mages.

AP items were nerfed a bit, and mages got better scaling, if I'm correct. Everyone _who didn't already have it_ (Most ranged champions and Yasuo) was given MR/level _to somewhat match armor/level_. You still get _less_ MR per level than you get armor per level.

 >We have ADC not only being played in the botlane, but also in the midlane (Lucien, Corki) and in the jungle (Twitch, Ezreal) and somehow you decide to nerf DPS mages out of the meta instead, every time they are remotely close to being viable.

I've covered both Lucian and Corki's reasons for being in mid. I haven't seen a Twitch in the jungler for a _year_, now, because he's so locked into predetermined paths that he kinda just sucks in it. Any decent player can just interrupt his path and crush him. Ezreal has a 47% win rate in the jungle, and he's there because he _can't go anywhere else and succeed_. He has to settle for a goddamned 47% win rate at a role, because _every other way is worse_. He's objectively the worst ADC right now, has no ability to support (except for a tiny AS boost on his W, I think), doesn't really work in mid (too many mages there crush him), and..._might_ work top, I suppose? Maybe? Assuming he's against an immobile melee champion that isn't Nasus or Cho'gath, he might do fine. Maybe.

> **Opposed to ADC DPS-Mages actually have counterplay. Yet a Cassiopeia {{champion:69}}  can be place #98 in terms of winrate (Diamond rank OP.GG stats, dropped further to #100 today 15th september) and be nerfed while a #10 winrate Twitch {{champion:29}}  remains untouched.

Marksmen have _more_ counterplay than DPS mages. Sure, they can't miss you with their primary source of damage, but they also generally have no CC to stop you from blowing them up (of the top 3 meta ones of Tristana, Twitch, and Draven, only Trist has reliable self-peel. Draven has a minor displacement that can be dodged, and Twitch only has a laughable slow). Most DPS mages, while they _can_ miss _sometimes_, tend to have a solid amount of CC. Cassiopeia in particular has her ultimate (can't be dodged if you're running at her) and her grounding, both things that can mess up any mage or assassin _big-time_.

1.) So you are arguing a scenario where he always has ulti up and ready? What about the remaining 2 minutes while it's down?
2.) Uhm. Corki has always been a midlaner? I am just playing since before season 1 and the original release - and he has never been a competitive midlaner. He was playable in low elo midlane matches from time to time, but he just started being a viable midlaner with his rework and how broken AD itemization currently is when compared to AP items.
3.) A lot of mages did not get a single scaling change - and if you consider taking 50 AP of an item "A bit" I feel we have a very different definition of that term. Especially if those nerfs were made to several items which add up - particularly in lategame scenarios where according to Riots scaling justifications APCs should have good DPS.
4.) I frequently see Twitch jungle - and I also see it being played on Master rank streams. 
5.) Ezreal has a 62,87% winrate in jungle at Challenger according to OP.GG. Which is nowhere near the 47% you claim. There's power gaps for skill heavy champions. Just as with Twitch above: Just because you doesn't face it doesn't mean that it's balanced.
6.) "Marksman have more counterplay than DPS mages" So a 800 range, instant damage Twitch right click has more counterplay than a Cassiopeia which has to hit you with a 0,4s delayed skillshot and follow up with a lower ranged E? While each of these consumes mana.
7.) "Marksman have no CC". Ashe R, Vayne E, Varus R, Xayah E, Tristana R, Draven E, Kalista R. That's just counting hard CC and ignoring stuff like Ashe's perma slow.... Meanwhile we have a low range knockback on Azir and an extremely conditional, bugged, unreliable and also avoidable stun on Cass.

EDIT: Downvote 15 seconds after I wrote this post. Either you are the fastest reader on earth or you downvote before you read. Call me mean for assuming the 2nd... Some people only read what they want to read - and others don't even try. No reasonable arguing with you I guess, but well if you claim that an unavoidable right click has more counterplay than landing significantly delayed skillshots there wasn't really much sense in your statements to begin with...

Maybe a loss of 100 or so AP overall? That's honestly not that much.

> 4.) I frequently see Twitch jungle - and I also see it being played on Master rank streams. 

<insert X-Doubt meme here>. He has _the_ most predictable jungling path there is. I sincerely doubt that it'd be played in Masters, except for shits and giggles, or as a counter pick.

Ezreal jg sucks ass against anyone that knows how to play safe. Your numbers are evidently bullshit.

> 6.) "Marksman have more counterplay than DPS mages" So a 800 range, instant damage Twitch right click has more counterplay than a Cassiopeia which has to hit you with a 0,4s delayed skillshot and follow up with a lower ranged E? While each of these consumes mana.

800 range for 5 seconds. You can _literately_ just walk away from him, then fight 5 seconds later. Have you tried doing that?

You can also just use a good gap-closer and blow him up. He has no CC to stop you.

And Cass pretty much never runs OOM. She fucking buys RoA and tear. Unless you're throwing all of your abilities non-stop, it's virtually impossible to run out of mana with those two items.

She's also harder to blow up, for the reason that she has RoA and has CC.

> 7.) "Marksman have no CC". Ashe R, Vayne E, Varus R, Xayah E, Tristana R, Draven E, Kalista R. That's just counting hard CC and ignoring stuff like Ashe's perma slow.... Meanwhile we have a low range knockback on Azir and an extremely conditional, bugged, unreliable and also avoidable stun on Cass.

#***I SPECIFICALLY SAID THE TOP THREE META CHAMPIONS HAD LOW CC***

Do ***not*** try to put words in my mouth. With the _exception_ of Ashe, who is half support, anyways, most marksmen have ***LITTLE*** cc. ***SOME*** have none, moreso than most other classes (barring assassins, who generally have no CC).

Cass's stun is _not_ unreliable. She can just panic-use it and stun an assassin, who is _often dashing towards her_. Azir can R or WEQ away, and has enough range with his soldiers to pretty much never be in danger.

And the point i was making is YES those tank items dont do much against ADC, even though it was meant to counter them. Same with Adaptive Helm. Just because a tank buys it that doesnt make them an unkillable god.

Adaptive helm targets a specific class of league.

Not a general damage area of "I don't like AP/ I don't like AD" with armor and MR

It targets such a specific class that it's too good at shutting down the damage of the DPS mage.

If this item was even remotely whispered onto the PBE, the league community would call Riot out for how broken that defensive item would be.
Adaptive helm should be treated the same way. It needs  to have lowered stats with the same or higher gold pricing in order to be balanced and even then, the item is still too good.

Recent patches have been around pro plays. Cassiopeia was a dominant pick there as was lucian. Both got a nerf althoguh I agree lucian's nerf was really gentle. I guess they want to see him being played now and then in worlds.

Note that ADC is a broader class than just 'physical DPS ranged damage'. Lucian is very good mid, but sucks in the bottom lane. I think it's nice that this champ in particular found a home elsewhere. Perhaps, however, it's because other adcs are just too strong and it's easier to prey on the weaker midlaners. I think the adc+supp combo is a bit too strong atm. In ARAM this becomes VERY apparent. Facing an adc or a support without the other is fine. Facing both together, however, is just depressing. (By support I actually mean anything that can peel, not just the enchanters but also all tanks including a lot of toplaners and junglers). When there's an adc in your team, everyone with any sort of heal, shield or CC becomes a support to enable the ADC. I'm seeing this trend in LCS as well. It's less about midlane now, they'r basically the early game snowballers but later in the game, it's all about the adc. Toplane is just something to hold a lane for the early game and then protect the adc or disrupt theirs while functioning as a damage soak, trying to outlast the enemy frontline, because in no way are you actually going to KILL their ADC unless major missplays happen. A big part of this is the stronger support items that have more power put into buffing or protecting your team or just one member. Perhaps it's because mages got less damage and 40% CDR is ubiquitous. Maybe I'm exaggerating a bit because I think it has always been a bit like this, except when assassins were really strong and I didn't like those times. It's just a bit more pronounced now and small nerfs/buffs should happen to certain classes/items, not big ones.
ADCs can find a new home in other lanes meanwhile if a support goes any other lane they're nerfed or reworked to shackle them to bot

Riot explained that already and I agree with their statement. Supports don't get nerfed out of other lanes for the sake of it. Supports tend to have a less interactive kit because it's supposed to interact with your own team. But when you play them in a solo lane and only interact with yourself, it gets really boring to face that. For example a shield that's supposed to soak half of the trading damage in a 2v2 will soak all damage in a 1v1. Same thing why they removed a lot of off-builds like ap yi, ap gp, ap sion because they only use 2 abilities usually and have a really uninteractive play pattern. (Doesn't mean I didn't love playing those champs ;) ). Some champs have healthier off-builds like ap Ezreal or AP Kog'maw.

yeah but what about support champions like Alistar or blitz or prerework Taric? Champs which have very solo orientated kits (Hell Blitz inititally was DESIGNED as a top laner) yet they get nerfed into oblivion to their lane or reworked so they can only go bot lane and ONLY bot lane

Meanwhile you have ADCs going mid jungle and top and MId laners going support.

Why is it they have to make support champions ONLY able to support and not have the versatility of the other roles?
